70-yr-old man rapes sisters, aged 6 and.description: Bhopal: Two sisters — aged 6 and 8 years — were allegedly raped by a 70-year-old man in a village garden in Satna district of Madhya Pradesh on Thursday afternoon. The accused, Raghupath Singh, is a history-sheeter and his son is in jail for rape, say police. The sisters had run into the garden to gather mangoes that had fallen in a storm said SHO Mohit Saxena, who is investigating the case. “Singh threatened the girls and forced them to strip. The children were terrified,” said Saxena. A woman who lives near the garden saw him in the act from her terrace, and raised the alarm, but by then Singh had allegedly raped the sisters. “She ran towards them, shouting at him to leave the girls. Singh from the spot,” said the investigating officer. The girls’ family was informed. Police raided Singh’s house but he was gone. Search teams fanned out to look for him. On Friday morning, they found him cowering behind some boulders in the middle of a dry riverbed. He was charged under POCSO Act and IPC and is now in jail. The girls were given a medical examination and discharged from hospital. Their statements were recorded before a magistrate. “We have also recorded the statement of the woman, who is the key witness. We have also collected DNA samples for speedy investigation,” said Saxena, adding that the chargesheet will be filed at the earliest. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nityata youngest from MP to become Woman.description: Bhopal: World Chess Federation ( FIDE) has awarded women FIDE master title to 15-year-old chess player Nityata Jain. Now Nityata will be known as Woman Fide Master (WFM) Nityata Jain in the international chess world. She is the youngest girl from MP to achieve this feat.Nityata, a student of DPS Nipania in Indore, has been a consistent performer for the past four years in national and international circuits. Incidentally, she is the only WFM from Madhya Pradesh. Earlier, Kiran Agrawal had received WFM title when Chhattisgarh was part of MP. The WFM title is the third highest title awarded at the international level to women chess players who achieve international Fide chess rating of 2100 or above points. Recently on June 1, 2019, Nityata had increased her international chess rating by whopping 294 points in just one month to 2219 which helped her win the WFM title.Earlier, Nityata was awarded international chess title of woman candidate master (WCM) by World Chess Federation in 2018. Nityata has now crossed the minimum rating criteria of 2200 which is required to achieve her the Woman International Master (WIM ) title from World Chess Federation. Now she requires 3 WIM norms to achieve second highest international female chess title in the world.In order to achieve her goal, Nityata should continuously undergo grandmaster chess coaching as well as play more and more international tournaments, said her father Nitin Jain. “Exposure in grand master coaching and international tournaments will also enhance Nityata's chess knowledge and experience which will help her win more medals for India and MP,” said Nitin.So far, Nityata has brought laurels to India and MP by winning 7 international medals, 2 national school medals and 19 state gold medals in her chess career. Presently, Nityata is participating in the Balanton International Chess Festival IM Tournament. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

MP's Mirchi Baba fails to take jal samad.description: BHOPAL: Self-proclaimed godman Swami Vairagyanand Giri, known as Mirchi Baba, who performed a yajna for Congress leader Digvijiya Singh’s victory in Lok Sabha, reached Bhopal on Sunday — as announced — to take a ‘jal samadhi’ — but was unable to do so due to police presence. Mirchi Baba had announced that he would take a ‘jal samadhi’ if Singh loses. Heavy police force was deployed near where he was staying, to prevent any untoward incident. Mirchi Baba had on Thursday written an application to the collector seeking permission to take a ‘jal samadhi’ on June 16 at 2:11pm. Again on Saturday, he wrote another application to the collector through his lawyer demanding security as he intends to visit Bhojpur temple and then meet the official. Mirchi Baba did not visit the collector, instead reached a hotel near Minal Residency, where police force was already deployed. Talking to mediapersons, Mirchi Baba said: “I have taken a ‘sankalp’ and I am on it. I will continue to seek permission from the administration till June 20. If not given a permission until then, I will go on an indefinite fast after that.” He said, “I apologise, if any saint or citizen is hurt by my statements.” Mirchi Baba left Bhopal later in the night, said sources. Doctors strike hit OPD services in govt.description: BHOPAL: State capital has witnessed one of the most well-coordinated strike by doctors in recent past, which left services expect for emergencies in hospitals, paralysed, on Monday. The doctors were on a day-long strike in solidarity with the doctors protesting assault on them in West Bengal. Even in the private hospitals, OPD services were affected and planned surgeries had to be cancelled. An estimated 10,000 patients suffered without medical services on Monday. Hospitals impacted due to strike include AIIMS Bhopal, Hamidia hospital, Sultania hospital, Kamla Nehru, BHEL hospital, Bhopal Memorial hospital and research centre (BMHRC) and its mini-units and among others. Doctors working with state government-run hospitals did not participate in the stir but wore black bands in solidarity. “All private hospitals OPD services were closed. Eight medical colleges along with BMHRC and Kasturba hospital BHEL hospital were impacted also. The government needs to address the issue of violence against doctors and enforce protection act,” said United Doctors Federation, Bhopal, president, Dr Anoop Hajela. Around 5,000 doctors joined a march from Gandhi Medical College (GMC) to the divisional commissioner’s office, about two kilometres away. “It was one of the biggest rallies in the country,” he claimed. Protesting doctors used the hashtag #SaveTheSaviour #DoctorsFightBack #TreatUsAsHumans during the rally and posted their pictures and tweets on the go. The hashtag DoctorsFightBack was trending on twitter for the most of the day. Doctors also demanded for a comprehensive union government law to deal with violence against medical fraternity. Hundreds of patients gathered at the hospitals for OPD facilities were returned. Indian Medical Association (IMA) greater Bhopal Chapter, president, Dr Rajiv Gupta, said government must pass a law to make any attack on Docs a non-bailable offence with minimum 12 year jail term. People from outside Bhopal seeking medical services in the state capital, were affected the most. Around 1,000 patients from government hospitals were returned as OPD registration was closed on Monday. The number from private health care clinics and hospital, is estimated to be much higher. According to government hospital estimates, more than 150 planned surgeries were differed on Monday. Doctors want enforcement of protection act More than a decade after, Madhya Pradesh Doctors and Medical Services Act of 2008 came into force, doctors are not satisfied with its implementation. Point in case, are three recent attacks on doctors in Jabalpur and Gwalior, according to United Doctors Federation, Bhopal, president, Dr Anoop Hajela. In two different incidents, doctors in a private hospitals in Jabalpur were attacked. In one incident, hospital was attacked after an 85-year-old died within four hours of admission. In another incident 80-year-old patient with full-blown case of TB died, within half-an-hour of being brought to the hospital. In Gwalior, a government doctor, was thrashed after he refused to amend PMLC. “The implementation of Madhya Pradesh Doctors and Medical Services Act of 2008, has to be strict. In many cases, the police action is delayed citing patients death. Then the issue goes in the back burner. Cases have to framed in accordance with the law,” said Hajela. There are many instances of violence against doctors in the state capital. However, less than five are prosecuted, he claimed. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

\nCitizens enjoy Zumba workshop during R.description: Week after week, people from across age groups gather for the Raahgiri celebrations — exercising, walking and dancing their way to good health. And this week was no different.  While throngs of youngsters as always attended the Zumba workshop, it was heartening to see an increasing number of older people also making their way for the dance session. Burning calories by grooving to peppy numbers seem to be attracting more and more Bhopalites to come for these rigorous sessions. A lot of guests could also be seen walking next to the lake. Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Madhya Pradesh: Driver killed, four hurt.description: BHOPAL: A car driver lost his head while four others were injured after their vehicle collided with a JCB machine in Rajgarh district on Sunday morning. The incident took place near Silpati Jor, situated between Biaora and Suthalia, said sources. The deceased has been identified as Shailendra Parihar, resident of Madhusudhangarh in Guna district, said police. Sources said that the Parihar family of Guna district had come to attend a wedding in Rajgarh and were returning home on Sunday when the incident took place. The collision was so fierce that the roof of the car got completely damaged and Shailendra got beheaded, said sources. Five others have sustained injuries and are admitted at community health centre in Biaora and two of them were referred to district hospital, said sources. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Minister blames bats, poor maintenance f.description: Bhopal: Prevalence of bats is one of the reasons for tripping or disruption in power supplies in old city areas of the state capital, energy minister Priyavrat Singh told TOI. “I was informed that there are faults in old city areas due to bats sitting on distribution lines. However this only leads to .06% of the tripping. Actual problem is that mainteance has not been done properly over the past few years. Now, we have made a committee for every discom, which would specifically look into the fact that which component was damaged in which section or circle, for example if insulator of a particular place is burning ten times then there is some problem with the insulator that was supplied, so far there was no such mechanism to look into it. There are no specific records detailing the causes of faults in past years,” Singh said. Singh also said that, redistribution of the power distribution system of the state capital would be done to ensure effective distribution of power and convenience to consumers. Talking to media persons, on Friday Singh said, “The officials have been instructed to prepare a plan for redistributing the power distribution system of the state capital. This will bring uniformity and lead to effective management of power distribution in the state capital. There are several such distribution centers where pressure has increased due to expansion of the city. These issues will be solved with redistribution.” Speaking about the issue of power cuts, Singh said, “It is basically a propaganda by the Opposition parties. In reality, there are no power cuts. There is tripping due to technical faults but less tripping compared to previous year has been reported this year. We have also made a detailed communication plan to address the issue and ensure that whenever there is tripping, the actual cause of power supply disruption is known to the users and officials through WhatsApp groups.” “There have been instances wherein it has surfaced that the power supplies were deliberately disturbed and FIRs have also been registered in Damoh, Kolar of Bhopal and Indore. We have also asked the police patrolling teams to keep an eye on such instances. Officials have been instructed to keep an eye and instantly report such cases to the police,” he added. “We have changed more than 60,000 transformers since January 1, this year,” Singh said. “But the allegations of power cuts are mainly propaganda motivated by politics. The Opposition parties are not able to digest that they have been denied mandate by the people of the state. And to those who are trying to make their propaganda and protests successful by deliberately disrupting power supplies, I would like to say that people of state are seeing everything”, he added. Singh also said that instructions have been issued to the concerning officials to prepare a log of the faults that are being reported. If its reported that low quality equipment was used in works, then appropriate action would be taken.” Speaking about the power purchase agreements (PPAs) of the state government with the private power producers, Singh said, “The PPAs were done in a legal way and we are seeking legal advice on the issue”. 120km trip for ear surgery, all in vain.description: Bhopal: Hospital services at All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) Bhopal were thrown out of gear, owing to doctors stir, here on Monday. the all-India day-long strike called by Indian Medical Association (IMA) found support in AIIMS Bhopal, where regular OPD was just over 341, according to union government’s e-hospital dashboard. By Monday evening, hospital administration came out with an OPD figure of more than 1,500. Eye-witnesses said that more than 500 patients who had come seeking medical treatment from other towns to AIIMS Bhopal were disappointed. Bari Bareli resident Ram Bai was scheduled for an ear operation on Monday. Not aware of the stir, she travelled 120 km for more than four hours to find out that hospital services were shut-down. “There was not prior intimation. I am not sure when the surgery would take place,” she said. There were many others who were disappointed over the situation. Even though, emergency services were functional, the route to finding emergency care was difficult. Hospital wings near the registration counter were locked down. In each of the departments of AIIMS Bhopal, the number of doctors was insufficient even for emergency care. AIIMS emergency and trauma was only functional. Emergency patients were affected too as doctors staged protest at the entrance of the hospital. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP takes a dig at govt\u2019s \u2018hal.description: Bhopal: The BJP on Monday took a dig at the state government for celebrating ‘haf-year’ in office even though it has failed to fulfill any of the promises Congress made in its manifesto. BJP leaders said that the government did not even waive farm loans within 10 days as announced by Congress president Rahul Gandhi. The party must change the chief minister for failing to implement the scheme even after six-month of its rule in the state, they said. "The Congress government has accepted in the advertisement published in newspapers that the second phase of the loan waiver scheme will being launched now. This exposes the false claims of the party that it had waived off farm loans within 10 days of coming to power as announced by Rahul Gandhi", said former minister Narottam Mishra while addressing a press conference on six-months of Kamal Nath government. He claimed that 95 per cent of the farm loan beneficiaries in the state have not availed benefits up to Rs 2 lakh as claimed by the Congress. He said in the so-called first phase, farmers got benefit up to Rs 15,000 only on their total loan amount. "Congress has not only fooled the farmers, is also trying to cheat them in the name of PM Kisan Nidhi Yojana. The government is not submitting the complete list of farmers to the Centre for financial assistance of Rs 6,000 per annum under the scheme. So far, only 43,000 beneficiaries have been listed against 80 lakh farmers registered with the state government-run cooperatives and mandis", said Mishra. Taking a jibe at ‘half-year celebrations' of the government, Mishra said that it is for the first time in the country that any government is celebrating `half-year' of its rule. “Is the Congress government not sure completing one-year term in the state?" asked Mishra. He said all promises made by the government and listed in the report card presented before the press on Monday are unfulfilled even after six months of being in power. For every single crisis, they blame the opposition party and now they are celebrating their so-called success, he said. "For power cut, they blamed BJP, for water crisis and crimes, they pointed finger at the BJP. For scams in cooperatives, rape and murder of minors, doctors' strike and what not. They blame BJP for everything. Who is stopping them from taking action against culprits?” said Mishra. He said, “In six months, the government has failed to fulfil a single promise. After cheating farmers in the name of loan waiver, the party has not provided stipend to unemployed youths. The promise to provide scooter to students is still unfulfilled. People are facing acute water and power crisis, now employees were suffering due to mass transfers". Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Now, bar licence just a click away in MP.description: BHOPAL: Getting bar licence in Madhya Pradesh is set to get simpler than ever before. A hotel owner just needs to pay online fees and would get bar licence within a set time-frame. The excise department is already in talks with government agencies to get a portal ready wherein the bar licence seekers can apply. Minister for commercial taxes Brajendra Singh Rathore confirmed it and said plan would start taking shape in a month. Objective behind the move is cut short the time exhausted in procedural delays and to earn revenue. System is expected to get in going by the time new policy is in place, minister added. However, after simplifying the process government mulls to increase the fees for issuing bar licences. As of now, bar licence fees is Rs 13.75 lakh for restaurants and over Rs 18.15 lakh for hotels, which would go up once the online time limit bar licence issuing process is in place. Officials said bar licence seekers do not mind paying fees, but they request to issue the licence as soon as possible. As per current procedure, a person has to apply in district excise office for getting licence. The team conducts inspection and report goes to collector from where it is forwarded to excise commissioner and finally minister issues the licence. However, on the pretext of queries, the department hangs the process for months. In the new arrangement, time-limit for inspection would be fixed and all queries would be raised in one go to issue the licence. In the prevalent system, babus issue single query at a time to delay the matter as long as possible leaving the room for corruption. In the new system, an applicant can deem to get the bar licence even if the licence is not issued after the deadline is over. MP would not be the first state to adopt the online procedure. The system is already in place in few states, including Maharashtra where even liquor stock available in a bar can be monitored on day to day basis, officials added. The decision to start the process of easing the process was taken at a high level meeting chaired by chief minister recently. Officials said the incumbent government wants to make the other procedures too in excise department like auction of liquor contracts online. Government is also in process to remove the mandatory purchase of liquor for bars from shops within its vicinity, with an aim to get more variety for tipplers at competitive prices. \nPeople enjoy Bhangra themed party in B.description: Theme-based parties are one of the biggest draws for the club-hopping crowd in Bhopal and one such celebration recently drew a big crowd.  Organised at a club, this Bhangra party saw guests sporting colourful pagdis and dancing enthusiastically to rocking Punjabi beats that echoed through the pub.  As the dholwala played some peppy beats, the footloose partygoers could be seen matching their steps and performing some traditional bhangra steps. Foot-tapping music, free-flowing beverages and a lot of cheery camaraderie made the night a memorable one as the young crowd made the most of this unique theme-party. BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Chanchal Lahiri.description: KOLKATA: After a day-long search for magician Chanchal Lahiri (41),   who disappeared   while performing an underwater escape act in the Hooghly, police on Monday fished out his body from near Howrah. Later in the evening, Lahiri's brother identified his body. An initial police probe established that Lahiri on Sunday had made several mistakes while attempting the stunt popularised by the famous illusionist and stunt performer Harry Houdini almost 100 years ago. Mandrake trying similar stunt earlierMMiC still in shock after magician’s deathLahiri, who was to come out of the water after being thrown in with his hands and feet bound, , but also wore cumbersome clothing and guards that made swimming in the strong current extremely difficult. Magician PC Sarkar, a master of such stunts, said perhaps Lahiri "needed a little more practice". Lahiri's team, too, waited about 15 minutes after he was lowered into the water to raise an alarm. Chanchal Lahiri on the boat moments before he started the stunt on Sunday Lahiri’s hands and legs were tied with ropes and he was chained with six locks. "When he did not surface for a long time, people panicked. Some onlookers said they saw a man struggling, seeking help, in the middle of the river. Police were informed and a team of divers from the disaster management group joined the rescue operation," said DC (Port) Syed Waquar Raza. Cops will probe if he took advantage of some lacunae on part of the administration and probably paid for it with his life. "A case of negligence is likely to be registered," said a source. Lahiri being lowered into the Hooghly river as he performed one of his tricks in KolkataMagician’s body found; peers say he didn’t take proper precaution Sources said Mandrake never mentioned in his permission letter that he was going to jump into the water. "Lahiri stated the stunt was to happen on a boat or vessel. Hence, we allowed him permission," Raza said. The letter added that he wanted to take photographs and perform an extra event around 1.30pm. The final dip made by Chanchal Lahiri"He performed almost an hour earlier. Hence, river traffic police was absent," said a Port division officer. Police said Lahiri drowned around 12.30pm and it is unclear whether he was performing or practising the act. Moments before the stunt on Sunday, Lahiri said, "If you perform a dangerous trick perfectly, you are a magician. If you fail, it is always tragic." Mandrake's body was fished out on Monday"Bound and chained, Mandrake was lowered 30 feet under water. Thousands watched and it is impossible the cops missed the entire episode when even politicians were present," claimed a friend on Monday. In 2013, when Lahiri performed the same stunt, he was assaulted by the crowd of onlookers, who claimed they felt cheated because they had seen through the trick. Learn Mandana art form at IGRMS.description: BHOPAL: As part of the ‘Do and Learn series’ an eight-day workshop on Mandana paintings is being organized at IGRMS. The workshop begun on Wednesday. Mandana paintings belong to Meena tribe of Rajasthan and some parts of Madhya Pradesh. It is believed that the paintings protect the home from evil and thus, women draw it on walls and floors of the house. In older days, chalk solution and red ochre were used, but today’s modern tastes demand more vibrant palate, prompting artists to use colours. Mandana art is influenced by nature and its major themes include varieties of flowers, women at work, plants, birds and animals. The workshop is being conducted by Meena artist, Shri Ramdev Meena from Rajasthan said, “This art form is an oral tradition learnt only by emulation. As these days, socio-economic development has taken precedence over altruistic sentiments of the community, there seems to be very little time and space to practice this art which makes its preservation harder.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Junior doctors in Bhopal join IMA stir,.description: BHOPAL: Expressing solidarity with the doctors in West Bengal agitating against an attack on their colleagues, doctors and medical fraternity in Bhopal would go on one-day stir on Monday. Though emergency services will remain functional, the strike may affect outpatient departments in private and government run-hospitals for the day. Doctors at state government-run hospitals like JP hospital will be on duty. Services at Gandhi Medical College (GMC) and other government medical colleges across the state would remain affected. AIIMS Bhopal administration has also been notified about the stir. Going by health department estimates, around 10,000 OPD patients would have to defer their appointments across the state capital. About 30 planned surgeries in Hamidia hospital too are expected to be deferred. Madhya Pradesh Medical Doctors Association (MPMDA) maintained that emergency and critical cases including in-patient services would not be impacted by the one-day stir. Indian Medical Association (IMA) greater Bhopal chapter president Dr Rajiv Gupta said that the IMA stir call is for nationwide suspension of non-essential services only. MP nursing association, MP nursing homes association and others have also supported the stir. IMA, the apex body of doctors in the country, has also renewed its demand for a union government law to check violence against health care workers in hospitals. It said it should have a provision for a minimum of seven-year jail sentence to violators. Medical institutions like GMC have also been in the news for violence in hospitals and it has adversely affected patient care. Over the years, GMC administration has failed to install even CCTV surveillance for safety of doctors. When contacted, doctors of some private hospitals said that they support the stir but will refrain from going off duty. “We are with IMA and its call,” said a private consultant, seeking anonymity. Directorate of Medical Education (DME) and health department officials maintained that OPD services in state-run hospitals would continue as usual. A new dawn, future awaits Madhya Pradesh.description: Madhya Pradesh chief minister Kamal Nath has in a blog written on the completion of his six months in office said a new dawn and new future awaits the state. In the blog, Nath wrote, “After a long and hostile summer, monsoon is knocking at your doorstep, bringing with it new hopes. At the same time. it also recalls about the long pain each one of you have endured. Putting it in verse Nath writes, “Scorching heat was far long/ There was no respite/ Never was the weather so hostile/ The scorcher was long…/ 15 long years.” He further wrote, “The heat has singed everything in the state. The sun has affected the economy, good governance, respect to women folks, farmers’ livelihood, employment for youth, self-respect for Dalits and tribal folks. The economic mess left was so that the state had a revenue deficit of Rs 8 lakh crore making it difficult to pay wages of state government employees. On several occasions advances had to be sought from the RBI to meet the crisis. The state had a debt of Rs 1.87 lakh crore and investments failed to make it while there was no trace of good governance and justice. The fact is that 46,000 girls could not save themselves and another 48 lakh children suffered malnutrition. Farmers’ seeking true value for their farm yield were shot by bullets while the future of bright youth were compromised through Vyapam. That is, I inherited a listless administration. But as one say, God may be late but not unjust. Like the saying goes in Hindu mythology that as much Rohini heats there is a chance of good rain. Thus, it seems a happy end with onset of monsoon. First with farmers’ loan waiver at their doorstep and later with discounter electricity for all. Now, there is also a reduction in crimes. Girls are also getting an assistance of Rs 51,000 for marriage. Citizens of the state will now have Right to Water, Metropolitan Planning Authority is scripting a new story of development in the urban areas of the state while new investments are coming with job promise to 70% youth of the state. Houses of poor are being illuminated with subsidized power. It is said that power consumption is the benchmark for development, and in the last six months the power consumption has gone up from 16% to 48%. The state is also providing benefit of 27% reservations to the Other Backward Classes. The last six months has brought a new hope for the state with the girls scaling Mt. Everest, youth brimming with hope and farmers’ assured of better future. There are new opportunities for the tribals, OBCs and Dalits. Cattle are finding homes in good cow shelters and Narmada and Kshipra rivers are also promising to flow with full glory.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Less than 1% BU students got jobs on-cam.description: With inputs from Laveena Francis Bhopal: The city’s Barkatullah University (BU) could hardly place 1% students in the year 2017-2018. Of total 3090 students, the university could only provide on-campus placements to 22 students, whereas Indore’s Devi Ahilyabai Vishwavidyalaya (DAVV) placement record was 70% in the same period. The BU in its report, seeking better NAAC grading, to internal quality assurance cell (IQAC), admitted that only 22 students, which makes 0.71%, were placed on-campus in the year 2017-2018. The university’s report mentioned that only 100 of 3090 students participated in the placement process. And 22 of them were given on campus placement, and other 68 students got jobs off campus. On the other hand, students alleged that the university has never informed them about the placements on the campus. “BU has over 20 departments but no one has any bother as where these students will get jobs after completing degrees,” said Vipin Yadav, a student. Another student, Shruti Upadhyay complained about the quality of education. She said that most of the time research schools take the classes instead of permanent faculty members. BU has claimed in the IQAC report that it has 72 permanent teachers of which 67 are appointed for the P.hD course. Not only placements, but the university also lags behind in competitive exams as only 14 students could qualify GATE, and 6—SET, stated IQAC report Prof DC Gupta, BU’s IQAC in charge, said, “Since 2014 BU is suffering with poor placements as the then VCs did not pay much attention to the same. It requires collective efforts from everyone in the university While the BU professor blamed former Vice-chancellors for the lower placement percentage, DAVV Vice-Chancellor NK Dhakad attributed its performance to its specialized curriculum and placement cell. “DAVV is A grade university with high number of professional courses and most of which are unique. We have less conventional courses. We have made a centralized placement cell and companies have been coming here for several years now,” he added. Bhopal: Mercury dips below 40 degrees Ce.description: BHOPAL: After around four weeks of scorching heat the temperature finally dipped below the mark of 40 degrees Celsius on Thursday. The day temperature in Bhopal on Thursday was at 39.9 degrees Celsius giving some respite but the night remained warm in city and other parts of the state. Day temperature in Bhopal on Thursday was recorded at 39.9 degrees, two degrees more than normal mark, while night temperature in city was recorded at 30.6 degrees, five degrees more than normal mark. High temperature in night was due to clouding. Wind direction in city was south westerly and average wind speed was 24 kilometres per hour. Officials of meteorological department, Bhopal circle said day temperature in Bhopal came down 40 degrees mark after 25 days. Before this on May 19 last month, the day temperature was recorded at 39.9 degrees while temperature remained above 40 degrees after that and was hovering around 45 degrees for the past few days. Met officials said there is trough from Punjab to Gangetic West Bengal passing through north MP. Besides, there is moisture incursion in state. It has developed possibility of thundery development for at least two more days, met officials said adding, if cyclone Yuva would have not changed its course, it would increase moisture incursion in state resulting in more thundery activity. Highest temperature in state was recorded at 44 degrees in Naogaon and Shivpuri on Thursday. Places that recorded showers between 8.30am to 5.30pm in the day were Damoh 13mm, Jabalpur 10mm, Guna 2mm while Indore and Naogaon recorded trace of rain. In the forecast for Bhopal on Friday the met officials said there would be partly cloudy sky, possibility of thundery development, dusty winds and light rain during evening hours. Day and night temperature would be respectively at 40 degrees and 29 degrees Celsius while average wind speed will be 24 kmph In the forecast for state met department underlined possibility of thundery development, dusty winds and light rain for several places, including Rewa, Sidhi, Satna, Singrauli, Shahdol, Anuppur, Dindori, Umaria, Chhindwara, Mandla, Seoni, Balaghat, Jabalpur, Raisen, Sehore, Vidisha, Tikamgarh, Sagar, Chhatarpur, Betul, Harda, Hoshangabad, Neemuch, Mandsaur, Ratlam, Ujjain, Jhabua, Alirajpur, Indore, Dhar, Dewas, Gwalior, Shivpuri, Guna, Sheopurkalan, Morena and Bhind. Nath meets Shah, seeks funds for special.description: Bhopal: Chief minister Kamal Nath called on home minister Amit Shah in New Delhi on Sunday to discuss issues related to internal security and law and order in the state. This is Nath’s first meeting with Shah after he became home minister. Nath, who is in Delhi for the first meeting of Niti Ayog under the aegis of new NDA government, arrived at Shah’s residence in the evening, said sources in Mantralaya. The two spoke for almost an hour, and women safety was a key part of their discussions. After the meeting, Nath is believed to have sent a letter to Shah, seeking budgetary support of Rs 880 crore to set up a special cell in MP to prevent crimes against women and children. “Financial assistance will be required to set up a cell to check crimes against women, procure equipment for investigation, reorganize mounted troops and dog squad, and hire counsellors to deal with cases of crimes against women. This will require technically skilled manpower, patrol vehicles and office buildings,” Nath has said in the missive. The new cell will comprise investigating officers, legal advisers, prosecutors and counsellors, apart from DNA laboratories and mobile forensic teams, the CM ha written. “Crime against women and children is a sensitive issue. The state government is committed to strictly deal with offences against women and children. For this, support from the central government is urgently required,” says his letter. The meeting between the two stalwarts holds significance after BJP’s thumping majority in the recent Lok Sabha election, where Shah — as BJP president — had raised the issues of “mass transfers and deteriorating law and order” in Madhya Pradesh in his poll rallies. \nHistorical mela hosted for women, by w.description: A four-day long Meena Bazaar is currently on at Gohar Mahal, to the delight of women from across the city.  Dozens of women artistes from across the country are displaying products as varied as artificial jewellery, shoes, handbags, jute bags, ceramic show pieces and handlooms at the historical monument Gohar Mahal. During the era of the Nawabs, the palace used to host Meena Bazaar — the favourite spot for women to shop, and after a long time, the mela has been initiated again at Gohar Mahal.  Kutir Evam Gramudyog Minister Kusum Mehdele, who inaugurated the bazaar, told us, “It’s a good platform for female shopkeepers and buyers. This market is a one-stop place where they can enjoy shopping all the items of use. We will now organise Meena Bazaar every year here in Bhopal.”  Besides decorative items, the women seem to be most drawn towards fashion and lifestyle products here. From lac bangles to handloom fabrics such as chanderi and maheshwari as well as bagh prints, the options are aplenty. There is also a mehendi stall, offering designs in Arabian and Marwadi style for `50 and `100, respectively.  Nawabi-style glass vases and designer lamps are another highlight, which will cost you between `150-`1000. Another attraction are the wooden combs available in different shapes and sizes as well as the signature Bhopali batua (purse), costing between `250- `1000. Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23.
