Kisan Cong demands MSP for wheat, Bhavan.description: Bhopal: Madhya Pradesh Kisan Congress (Congress party’s farmers’ wing) on Saturday alleging ‘injustice and discrimination’ by the Centre demanded full payment of dues by the Union government for procuring wheat under Minimum Support Price (MSP) in the state. A memorandum addressed to President Ramnath Kovind was presented to governor Anandiben Patel at Raj Bhavan by Kisan Congress. The memorandum to the President said, “The Union government had authorized MP government for acquisition of 75 lakh tons of wheat. But, so far, has allocated funds for 67 lakh tons. Funds for procuring remaining eight lakh ton amounting to Rs 1,500 crore should be allocated so that farmers can be paid without any further delay.” The memorandum also alleged that payment of Rs 1,000 crore for last year’s Bhavantar Scheme is also due and Centre should release the payment. Speaking to TOI, state Kisan Congress president Dinesh Singh Gurjar said, “Today the Congress held its state-level meeting at the PCC office. We discussed the Lok Sabha elections and its results and the state government’s loan waiver scheme, reduction of power bills for the agrarian sector, farmers pension scheme and availability of fertilisers and seeds for the Rabi harvest season. Minister for agriculture Sachin Yadav who attended the meeting said agricultural loans at zero percent interest will continue.” Ministers Omkar Singh Markam and PC Sharma who were present at the meeting listened to the demands made by the Kisan Congress leaders and office-bearers. “We also demand that the Narendra Modi government should stop import of lentils. In Madhya Pradesh, a large portion of the state grows lentils and farmers are not getting fair price for their produce because of the Centre’s import policy. MSP for moong dal should be made Rs 8,000 per quintal and state government should be given funds for procuring lentil,” Gurjar added. He also said that Centre should pay an additional 50% of MSP as profit for farmers. “If the Narendra Modi government does not accept our demands, then Kisan Congress will protest on the streets. There will be agitation through across mandis and panchayats in the state,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Infant\u2019s head creates panic in Chat.description: Bhopal: There was quite a sensation at Chattarpur’s Civil lines area after the head of an infant was recovered late Friday evening. Police remained clueless as they approached neighbouring police stations to enquire regarding any missing person complaint. Civil Lines police station SHO Vinayak Shukla said the head was recovered from Satai road locality of Chattarpur. “The child seems to have been anywhere between two to 15 days old. Except the head, the remaining body of the infant has been eaten up by stray dogs. Even the head bears canine teeth marks. It is suspected that the child was abandoned by its parents. But police are working on various theories,” SHO Shukla said. Quoting a doctor’s report, he said it seemed unlikely that the infant was beheaded. The SHO added that a detailed post-mortem report is awaited. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Doctors strike.description: KOLKATA: Junior doctors in Bengal finally called off their week-long strike and promised to resume duty on Tuesday morning, ending a stir that crippled out patient departments (OPDs) and severely hit emergency services at hospitals across the state. At a meeting held at state secretariat Nabanna on Monday evening, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee told a team of 31 junior doctors, " Lakkhi chhele, ebar tomra strike tule nao (Please withdraw your strike like good boys)", which they agreed to. The "cordial" negotiations between the CM and doctors were broadcast live for about 100 minutes by two regional channels. The doctors, who had adopted a strident posture against the administration for the initial police inaction against the kin of a bereaved patient at NRS Hospital last Monday (incident that triggered the stir) relented in the face of genuine-sounding assurances from the CM. The state administration medical fraternity face-off escalated after Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee issued a stern warning of action against the strike during her visit to SSKM Hospital last Thursday. What could have also played on their minds was the rising public opinion against the continuing strike, especially after the CM's appeal for talks last weekend. The striking doctors returned to the NRS campus on Monday and, after another general-body meeting, made a statement: "We hereby announce the withdrawal of the strike by junior doctors." Several issues were discussed at the meeting. They ranged from security measures - collapsible gates for emergency wards, regulated entry for patients' kin and enhanced police presence on medical campuses with nodal officers responsible for law and order - to the CM's suggestion for third-party PR professionals, who could act as grief counsellors and handle communication between "overworked doctors" and "aggrieved patients' kin" and grievance cells for patients. "We are delighted with the cordial manner in which the meeting was held, the CM's caring touch and concrete suggestions and assurances to the issues raised by us," one of the junior doctors said. "They (doctors) have genuine demands. We have listened to them and taken decisions to resolve them. This must be a continuous process. We have to see to it that such untoward incidents are averted and action is taken if something happens," Mamata said. The CM's "gentleness", however, came with the message that she could not be bullied. Urged by the junior doctors to visit the doctor who was injured in the NRS attack, and come to the NRS campus, she said, "Leave certain things to us...Give me your word that you will resume duty." In Video:CM Mamata accepts proposal of doctors to set up Grievance Redressal CellDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Parents asleep, three-year-old girl drow.description: BHOPAL: A 3-year-old girl drowned in a bucket at her home while her parents were asleep on Saturday in Misrod area of Bhopal. Police said parents of the deceased child were ill and were sleeping after taking medicines. The girl got up and got down from the bed and went inside bathroom where she drowned in the bucket full of water. Incident came to light when her parents got up and looked for her. On finding her in the bucket, they rushed her to a nearby private hospital where she died during treatment. After initial probe, police handed over the child’s body to the family members without autopsy. Police said Surendra Raghuvanshi, a wholesaler dealing in cleaning material hails from Raisen district and lived with his wife and 3-year-old daughter in Misrod area. On Saturday morning, his daughter Adhya who was sleeping with her mother on the bed was found missing. When they searched for her, the child was found inside the bucket. Police said Surendra and his wife were unwell and were in deep sleep after taking medicines. They rushed her to hospital where she died an hour after treatment. Police said the parents said that three days ago also the child reached the bathroom, but was spotted and saved by her parents. She was the only child of her parents and was to go to school during the new academic session. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nPriyanka Chopra, Prakash Jha address t.description: A couple of days before the shooting of Prakash Jha’s Gangaajal 2 wrapped up, the film’s cast got together to interact with the media in the city.  Addressing the crowd, Priyanka Chopra, who plays a tough cop in the film, said, “I will miss Bhopal a lot and having spent a month here, I have fallen in love with the place. The people here are very cooperative and it has been a memorable shooting experience here.”  Besides Chopra, the other actors, including Rahut Bhat, Murli Sharma and Manav Kaul, were also present. Praising the beauty and the cooperation received by them, Jha said, “Bhopal is a place where shooting can be done with ease and the credit goes to the audience here.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Congress hails Kamal Nath\u2019s six-mon.description: BHOPAL: On the eve of chief minister Kamal Nath completing six months in office, Congress hailed him as a “silent worker” who has tirelessly worked towards implementation of Congress party’s “Vachan Patra” (manifesto) in letter and spirit. Congress termed Nath government as practical, unlike the BJP, which it said believed more in propaganda. Former leader of opposition in the state assembly, Ajay Singh, while congratulating Nath on completing six months in office, said efforts made by him after taking over reins of the state to implement Congress party’s “Vachan Patra” has benefitted every section of society. He said the manner in which Kamal Nath government has “silently” gone about doing its job gives hope that in the five years of his regime, MP would script a new story of progress and prosperity. State Congress media cell has brought out a 63-page booklet titled “Badlav Ka Pehla Padav” (The first milestone of change) which highlights major achievements of the state government. Among other things, the biggest beneficiaries have been the farmers’ and loan waiver benefitted 19.97 lakh farmers while the youth welfare department’s “YUVA Swabhiman Yojana” has guaranteed 100 days of employment to unemployed youths. The industries department has 70% reservation to local youths while in the education department, there is a promise of recruitment of school teachers on 52,000 vacant posts and in the health department obstetric ICUs were opened in 11 district hospitals, said the booklet. Congress booklet further credited Kamal Nath government for construction of 1.12 lakh houses in rural areas, stipend to 30.98 lakh students from OBCs and minorities, implementation of 12 projects worth Rs 193 crore in seven smart cities of the state. It further said that 19,796 MW power is available in MP now, which is an all-time high, and power shutdown had gone down by 9% compared to the past. Wages for tendu collection to tribals has been raised from Rs 200 per sack to Rs 250, complete ban on polythene has been imposed, 4676 e-rickshaws have been registered during the period and PWD has constructed 1300 Km roads and M P Road Development Corporation 649 Kilometer. The booklet further highlights about additional dearness allowance for state government employees from January 2019, one day holiday in a week for police personnel and increasing reservation for OBCs from 13% to 27%. It also speaks about the committee to draft Water Act 2019 to ensure availability of clean drinking water to everyone in MP. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Narendra Modi.description: NEW DELHI: Urging the opposition to stop worrying about numbers, PM Modi on Monday said every word of the opposition was important and all efforts should be made for a " nishpaksh" (non-partisan) approach to issues of public welfare and the larger interest of India. His remarks at the start of the first session of the 17th Lok Sabha echo his announcement on Sunday of a meeting of leaders of all parties and an informal interaction of MPs, in what is seen as a bid to break the ice after a bitter poll campaign. "The opposition should stop worrying about numbers. The people have given them a certain number. Every word of the opposition is important. When it comes to Parliament, we should forget the ruling side and opposition. We should think of issues with a nishpaksh spirit," Modi said. The Prime Minister said an active and effective opposition is a necessity in a democracy and pointed out that a well- argued and factual criticism of the government strengthens democracy. "Sometimes such positive contributions are not noticed as they do not get high TRPs," he said. Though he did not mention the media, he said highlighting such efforts would strengthen the functioning of Parliament. Modi noted that the recent elections have yielded several firsts such as the highest number of voters exercising their franchise since Independence, a high number of women voters and a higher representation for women in Parliament. "It is also after several decades that a government has been re-elected with a bigger majority," he said. Referring to his recent speeches, the Prime Minister said that "we started with ' sab ka saath, sab ka vikas', but the people have added an unprecedented 'vishwas' (trust) to the matter". He said Monday marks the the start of the first session after the 2019 Lok Sabha polls. "I welcome all new MPs. With them comes new hope, new aspirations and new determination to serve," he said. In Video:Oppositions' every word is valuable: PM Narendra ModiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

First in country: Four model railway cro.description: Bhopal: In a first in the country, DRM Bhopal has developed four model railway crossings with better amenities and infrastructure for gatemen. These are developed on the Bina-Guna rail block.DRM Bhopal Uday Borwanker said it has been done to provide gatemen better safety, security and other facilities. Model railway crossings have been developed at gate no-10 (near Mungawali railways station), gate no-50 (near Shahdora railway station), gate no-3 (near Bina railway station) and gate no-297 (near Kalhar railway station). At the model railway crossings, RO water machines, separate cabin for gateman, solar panels, hand-pump and planation have been done. “Besides, a toolkit is provided at all these railway crossings. Earlier, gatemen had to face a lot of challenges in different conditions. Such railway crossings will make a big difference,” said Borwanker. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Now, free e-rickshaws to help passengers.description: Bhopal: The Bhopal City Link Limited (BCLL) has started an e-rickshaw facility for passengers opting for its buses. Free of charge, feeder rickshaws are currently on trial at Kolar, Lal Ghati and BHEL areas. The feeder service would pick and drop passengers to the bus stops. BCLL aims to operate as a seamless, integrated travel from colonies to the bus stops. If successful, the system would be operational across the state capital, said BCLL director KevalMishra. The move comes ahead of the government policy to improve public transport and announcement of a new metropolitan area for Bhopal. It would also fulfil one of the requirements in the policy, as the state capital prepares to receive funding for the ambitious Bhopal metro project. “The objective is to ensure that the lowest cost mass transit mode is selected for public transport,” said a BCLL official. The e-rickshaw facility is also linked to the BCLL's ticketing mobile application. The service will provide connection to the bus stops from select colonies and vice-versa. It is available in Avadhpuri, Ayodhya Nagar, Mandakini campus, Kolar and adjoining areas. BCLL operates 16 regular buses for different routes in these areas. Reducing travel time, the feeder route e-rickshaws would operate at peak hours for passenger convenience. It is free of any charge. “Residents of the colony using this e-rickshaw are enjoying the benefits of travelling in BCLL buses,” said Rakesh Singh, a resident of BHEL. Earlier, most of the commuters had to travel more than 2-3 km to reach the bus stop. “My residence is about 2 km from the main bus stop. It has also helped students living in far-flung colonies to reach the bus stop with ease,” said Ramlesh, a school teacher. The facility for the passengers to reach their destinations with ease is likely to be extended to other locations across the state capital, said Mishra. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nFive-day film festival 'Ekagra' commen.description: Ekagra, a five-day film festival, commenced with the film Bhuvan Shome, directed by renowned filmmaker Mrinal Sen, at Bharat Bhavan.  Made in 1969, Bhuvan Shome was one of the most appreciated films of its era. The fest will continue till July 5 and some of Hindi and Bengali cinema’s best films by Sen will be screened here.  Bhuvan Shome was a film made on a tight budget but it played a key role in establishing Sen as one of the most respectable filmmakers of that time and he won many accolades for it, including best feature film and best direction. The movie is based in the 50s where Bhuvan Shome, played by Utpal Dutt, is a strict but dedicated senior railway officer. His colleagues are always discussing his strictness but Bhuvan continues with his work without paying attention to them.  The film follows his life as he decides to go for a bird hunting holiday where he meets Gouri, a young and beautiful, easy-going girl. Bhuvan is bowled over by her and in turn, she has a great impact on his life and he lets go of his extra strict behaviour. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bhopal\u2019s Gaurav Jain bags AIR 93 in.description: Bhopal: Gaurav Jain of Bhopal has secured an All-India rank (AIR) of 93 in the joint entrance exam (JEE Advanced). He is the only student from Bhopal who managed to secure a place in the top 100. Tulip Pandey, who completed class 11 from Bhopal and then shifted to Mumbai, has secured AIR 79. She is also third in the country among girls. Gaurav has scored 271 out of 360 marks. He was a student of FIITJEE Bhopal Centre’s Pinnacle Program. He was also the Bhopal topper in JEE Main 2019. Gaurav completed class 12 from Gyan Ganga School with 94.4%. “Coaching as well as home study has helped me secure such good ranking,” said Gaurav. He said he had started his preparations right from Class 9. “Making it to the IIT has been my dream since class 9. Coaching helped me accomplish this dream,” said Gaurav. This year, 1.73 lakh students had appeared for JEE (Advanced) from across the country. It was held on May 27. A student, Nitin Khare, said, “I worked hard and am hoping to get a good ranking.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nCM Shivraj Singh Chouhan inaugurates P.description: The three day Police Kala Mahotsav was inaugurated recently by Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan at Bharat Bhawan. The program opened with an exhibition highlighting the services rendered by the police officials in the form of paintings, poems, photographs and sculptures along with a play titled Vardiwale. A rare collection of books from the police headquarters was also kept on display for the exhibition. The collection included books from 1867 till post-independence. German box cameras invented in 1954 and paintings highlighting the tough life of police officials, made by students and artists from various states, were also on display.  Directed by Ashok Bulani and written by Vijay Shankar Mehta, Vardiwale, based on a true incident that happened in Ujjain around 20 years ago, saw mature acting and perfect dialogue delivery, thereby leaving the audiences spellbound. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Computer Baba \u2018raids\u2019 sand min.description: BHOPAL: After he was denied a chopper for an aerial survey of illegal sand mining in river Narmada, Computer Baba challenged the sand mafia and chased them in a boat on Sunday night. However, his effort went in vain. Not to be outdone, he again “raided” some mines on the banks of Narmada in Sehore district and “impounded three sand-laden tractor trolleys”. Namdeo Das Tyagi aka Computer Baba, with a status of minister, is the chairman of Ma Narmada, Ma Kshipra and Ma Mandakini Trust and is entrusted with the duty of conservation of the rivers. “As the monsoon approaches, there is total ban on sand mining,” Baba told TOI adding: “ I confiscated three tractor trolleys loaded with illegally mined sand from Somalwada village in Budhni tehsil of Sehore district and handed it over to SDO Police and sub-divisional magistrate.” He said, “Most of the sand mining is taking place in Budhni.” On Sunday night, when he was camping at the Circuit House in Hoshangabad, he was told about the presence of many trucks loading sand across the river. “When I saw the trucks being loaded, I decided to cross the river by boat. I had also informed the district collectors of Sehore and Hoshangabad,” he said. “But as I was crossing the river, the boat stuck midway as there was not enough water for the boat to reach at the bank of the river,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

At Niti meet, Nath pitches for agri mark.description: Bhopal: Chief minister Kamal Nath stressed on the urgent need for agriculture market reforms so that farmers get handsome prices for their produce. Speaking at the fifth meeting of governing Council of Niti Aayog at New Delhi on Saturday, Nath called for structural reforms by all states and for suitably amending the Agriculture Produce Marketing Committee Act and Essential Commodities Act 1955. He also drew attention towards e-National Agriculture Market scheme saying that e-payment system is yet to be developed due to which States are facing problem and grievances redressal mechanism needs to be put in place. He said quality of a produce should be treated uniformly by all mandis and said APMC Act needs to be modified so that states have farmer centric systems there. Describing conservation of rainwater harvesting as imperative for sustainable development, chief minister said the demand of water for human and industrial consumption will rise in proportion to increase in population. Watershed development activities need to be strengthened in every state to replenish the groundwater resource. Giving example of Madhya Pradesh, Kamal Nath informed that river flow restoration project is under implementation to improve catchment area of 40 rivers in water stressed districts. In view of reported late arrival of monsoon, suitable varieties of seeds are being made available to the farmers with the help of agriculture universities. On the other hand, district disaster management plans have been updated in view of possible flood situation. On security issues and those concerning the left-wing extremism infected regions, Nath said special intelligence branches involving locals should be set up. Information sharing between affected states and confidence building measures involving the local communities must be carried out in active collaboration with the Centre. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. #MyParentsMyResponsibility urges for a b.description: Bhopal: With an aim to sensitize youngsters and working adults towards their elderly parents, NGO named Help Age India staged street play— My parents my responsibility, at MP Nagar-based mall on Thursday.The play also aimed to create awareness about ‘World Elder Abuse Awareness Day’, celebrated every year on June 15.The story showcased the several problems that our elders face in their daily lives. And, the national research surveys carried out by the organization revealed the wide prevalence of elder abuse in our country. Following this, a report ‘Elder Abuse in India - Role of Family: Challenges and Responses’ will be released on the weekend.It was found that elderlies are more vulnerable to abuse/poor treatment at home than anywhere else, especially by younger population.The aim of this study is to evaluate the efforts required to take care of an elderly person at home, from the point of view of working adult generation aged between 35 to 50 yrsSeclusion and lack of emotional support are some of the major problems faced by the senior citizens.To support the cause, the organization is also running a campaign on social media with #MyParentMyResponsibility, urging people to raise voice against elders’ oppression and take immediate action for their rehabilitation and right to safe and caring life.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Anantnag Encounter.description: SRINAGAR: An Army Major died while another officer of the same rank and two soldiers were injured in a gunfight at Bidoora village, in Achabal area of south Kashmir's Anantnag district, on Monday, a defence spokesman said. A Pakistani terrorist was killed in the encounter. Major Ketan Sharma of 19 Rashtriya Rifles, who died in the Achabal encounter, belonged to Meerut. A police officer said they had found the body of a Pakistani terrorist and seized arms and ammunition from the encounter site. The identity of the slain terrorist was being ascertained. In another attack, at least nine Army soldiers were injured in an IED blast that targeted a security vehicle of 44 RR at Aarihal village in Pulwama on Monday evening. Those injured in the Achabal gunfight and IED blast were rushed to the Army's 92 Base hospital in Srinagar, officials said. In the third attack in 24 hours, terrorists lobbed a grenade at the headquarters of the 180 CRPF battalion camp in Tral sub-district of Pulwama late on Monday evening. The grenade exploded outside the headquarters. No casualties have been reported. The first attack happened on Monday morning when a team of security men was on a cordon-and-search operation in Achabal. Terrorists fired at the team, who then retaliated. In the Pulwama attack, the terrorists after setting off the IED, opened fire at the Army vehicle. "Initial reports reveal the vehicle suffered extensive damage," the official said. Three of the soldiers injured in the blast were said to be serious, sources said. Soon after the attack, Army, police and SOG reinforcements were rushed to the spot and a massive search operation was launched. A defence spokesman, however, said some of the men sustained minor injuries in the IED blast. Damage was minimal due to the alertness of the patrol party, he said. The vehicle was an armoured ALS and not a Casspir (a mine-resistant, ambush-protected vehicle), he added. Cong\u2019s Jhabua dilemma: Feuding Bhur.description: Bhopal: With the elevation of BJP’s GS Damor from the state Assembly to the Lok Sabha, Jhabua assembly seat will go for bypoll within six months. And the state Congress, which is running a government with 114 party MLAs (two seats short of absolute majority) with the support of independents and SP-BSP, is eyeing this one tribal reserved seat with great expectations. Jhabua win can take Congress and Kamal Nath government one more step closer to majority at 115, which would be just one seat short of the magic number 116 in a House of 230. Also, a victory in Jhabua bypoll would ensure that BJP suffers a setback and its number reduces from the 109 seats it won in November assembly elections to 108. Increase in Congress’s numbers by even one seat can ensure Kamal Nath government stability as independents breaking away and others would still not give the BJP the required numbers to form the government here. But the Congress’s main hindrance for Jhabua is its own factional feud between former Union minister and party’s tribal leader Kantilal Bhuria and former MLA from the same seat Jevier Medha. Retired government engineer GS Damor won his debut election venture last November when as the BJP candidate he had defeated Kantilal Bhuria’s son Dr Vikrant Bhuria. While Damor secured 66,598 votes and Vikrant Bhuria got 56,161 votes, independent candidate Medha pulled off 35,943 votes. Just days before the elections, Medha was expelled by Congress for fielding himself as an independent candidate. He was annoyed as the party denied him a ticket from the seat. In 2008, Medha - the then Congress candidate - became an MLA after defeating BJP’s Pavesingh Pargi from the same seat by 19,000 votes. But in 2013, Medha lost to BJP’s Shantilal Bilwal by a margin of 16,000 votes. Because he lost to Bilwal, Congress denied him ticket in 2018 and when the party fielded Dr Vikrant Bhuria, Medha became the rebel who had to be ousted for indiscipline. Congress losing Jhabua with Medha securing 35,943 seats became a headache for five-time MP from Ratlam Lok Sabha seat Kantilal Bhuria before the Parliamentary elections. Jhabua is one of the eight assembly constituencies in Ratlam Lok Sabha seat. Realising that Medha was a rival he could not ignore, Kantilal Bhuria had his Congress membership reinstated. Bhuria contested Lok Sabha elections from Ratlam but lost to Damor, who after his assembly election victory, was fielded by BJP for Lok Sabha polls from Ratlam. State BJP president Rakesh Singh confirmed that Damor will retain his Lok Sabha seat and thereafter, he resigned from the assembly. As both the parties get ready for battlefield Jhabua, Congress has two prospective candidates for the bypoll – former MP and Union minister Kantilal Bhuria or former MLA Jevier Medha. The dilemma is whom to field – Bhuria, whose son Vikrant lost in November and he also faced a defeat in Lok Sabha or Jevier Medha, the rebel. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

DRM develops four model railway crossing.description: BHOPAL: In a first in the country, the divisional railway manager (DRM) of Bhopal has developed four model railway crossings with better amenities and infrastructure for gatemen on the Bina-Guna block. Model railway crossings have been developed at gate no-10 (near Mungawali railways station), gate no-50 (near Shahdora railway station), gate no-3 (near Bina railway station) and gate no-297 (near Kalhar railway station). The DRM, Uday Borwanker, said people have liked the concept very much. “We have completed the first phase. I have directed the divisional engineers of different sections to keep developing such crossings in their locations,” said Borwanker. Around 10-15 model railway crossing will be developed in the near future. Asked about the reason of developing such crossings, Borwanker said, “Several programmes were organized in the past to make the masses aware of safety and security while passing through such crossings from the road. However, I wanted to work for the gatemen who perform their duty in interior parts in challenging situations.” He added that the objective behind developing such model crossing was to improve conditions at the crossing along with amenities for the gatemen. At the model railway crossings, RO water machines, separate cabin for gateman, solar panels, hand-pump and plantation have been done. “Besides, a toolkit is provided at all these railway crossings. Earlier, gatemen had to face a lot of challenges in different conditions. Such railway crossings will make a big difference,” said Borwanker. The DRM also added that Indian Railways is planning to shut down road overbridges and under-bridges. “It will take time. Till that time, we have decided to develop model crossing in locations where it is required most,” said Borwanker. Gatemen have welcomed the model railway crossings. “There are railway crossings which are completely in dense forests. In such situations, if such model railways crossings are developed, it would motivate gatemen,” said a gateman without wishing to be named. In the second phase, model railway crossings will be developed on the Habibganj-Harda and Bhopal-Maksi blocks. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

MP: IFS officer pledges to donate body t.description: BHOPAL: A forest officer with a passion for eco-conservation has pledged to donate his body to science so that it may save the three quintals of wood needed to cremate it when the time arrives. Harish Chandra Gupta Gupta, a 1998 batch IFS officer, completed the formalities on May 25 and shared it with colleagues on Thursday. Gupta, now posted as DFO in Vidisha, wants his body to be given to a medical college. “I spent my life protecting wildlife and forests and want to do the same after my death. At least 3 quintals of wood is required to burn a body. A tree will have to be cut for this. Besides, the pyre leads to pollution,” he said, adding: “Environment has given a lot to humans, and now it is time for us to repay in whatever small way we can. I would be happy if just four people, be it officers or employees from my department or outside, pledge their bodies after being inspired by me.” The decision to give one’s body for research instead of performing the last rites is a tough one in India. Gupta’s family, too, resisted the idea but he managed to convince them. “Awareness is rising,” he said. After signing the documents known as ‘dehdan vasiyat’, Gupta uploaded a video on social media in which he repeats the pledge. “This is to avoid any confusion since there are instances where people pledged their body but it wasn’t followed in true spirit after death,” he said. He said he was inspired by an organ donation drive started by social worker Vikas Pachori. Over the past year, 198 people have signed up for body donation in Vidisha. Gupta runs a campaign where saplings are grown in used plastic milk packets and handed to students for plantation and care. He has given 50,000 such saplings to students in the district, and set up 10,000 ‘nest boxes’ to save house sparrows during summer. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. Encephalitis.description: Bihar is in the grip of Encephalitis. At least 108 children have lost their lives due to acute encephalitis syndrome (AES) in its Muzaffarpur district. AES accompanies flu-like symptoms such as high fever, headaches and convulsions. Japanese encephalitis virus (JEV) is the major cause of AES in India besides other sources such as bacteria, fungus, parasites, spirochetes, chemicals, toxins, and non infectious agents. Here's more. Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .
